name: Fructose
desc: Fructose is also called fruit sugar, because it occurs in its free state mainly in fruits, but also in honey, flower nectars and in smaller amounts in vegetables. Unlike glucose, Fructose is metabolized without insulin. Fructose can be found in products labeled as E420.
techs: Fructose is a simple sugar that belongs to the group of ketoses. It has an identical molecular formula as glucose, but a different arrangement of atoms in the molecule. Fructose has the highest sweetness of all sugars.
shelf: The shelf life of Fructose is 24 months, if stored properly in a cool, dry location.
packaging: Foodcom supplies its Business Partners with Fructose in 25 kg bags or Big Bags, and Bulk.
applications: Fructose is used as a powerful sweetener and preservative. It is widely used to extend the shelf life of baked goods and to prevent confectionery from drying out and crystallizing. Baked goods with added Fructose are characterized by an attractive color. It also provides a smooth consistency in ice cream.
